item.title: Gitlab Reconnaissance Introduction
item.description: Although Gitlab is not as popular as Github, itâ€™s common to run across it these days. Especially after Microsoft acquired Github it seemed more individuals and organizations flocked over to Gitlab. In this post I want to document a couple of recon commands that are useful post-exploitation, and for blue teamers to watch out for. Let’s assume one has access to a Gitlab Token as a precursor. Let’s walk through some interesting commands and script snippets to leverage to find out more.
